content.text: Several users discussed AI agents and automation technologies. @elizaOS announced that "autonomous accounts aren't theoretical anymore" and invited users to test @theinterndotfun, a tool for deploying AI-run X accounts for marketing and community management. They also shared that "agents don't clock in they just go off" and emphasized "trusted agents" with "no drama, just execution" in collaboration with @iEx_ec for confidential AI running in Intel TDX. @elizaOS further promoted "Auto-pilot on Base" through Pro Agent, which allows humans and agents to manage liquidity pools on Aerodrome and Uniswap. @autodotfun tweeted that "Some people trade tokens. Some people mint agents. Guess which one's fun?" @shawmakesmagic posed questions about the nature of agents, asking "What if the organization is the agent?" and "Shared memory for agents? You mean social media?" @dankvr suggested that @elizaOS/ai16z holders would soon experience "the most innovative governance system that any DAO/open source project has ever seen" with "early results [that] left leaders speechless."

content.theme_title: AI Impact on Work and Economy
content.text: Several tweets addressed AI's impact on work and the economy. @shawmakesmagic retweeted @a_musingcat's observation that "we built this big beautiful economy full of fake jobs before AI. i don't see why we wouldn't keep it full of fake jobs after AI." Another retweet from @airkatakana noted a "highly overlooked part of ai is that it enables humans to do very high quality work even while tired, drunk, etc." In response to a post about a Computer Science graduate with a 4.0 GPA working at Walmart, @shawmakesmagic commented on the competitive job market, suggesting that AI only needs to beat a "$14/hr salary." @shawmakesmagic also retweeted @0xMert_'s post expressing "physical pain" over what appears to be AI-related content.

Several tweets focused on cryptocurrency and decentralized finance. @autodotfun emphasized their fee structure, stating "50% is cute. We do 90%" in response to @shawmakesmagic's earlier tweet comparing fee distributions. @comput3ai, retweeted by @shawmakesmagic, announced "AI16Z / COM LP on Raydium is here!" in partnership with @ElizaEcoFund, mentioning plans for "deeper integrations into Comput3 by 'Autonomous' Agents" and upcoming features like "Staking, more LP & rewards." @elizaOS shared information about Pro Agent, which "allows Humans and Agents to start saving on Base" through a "Liquidity Manager contract for Aerodrome and Uniswap Liquidity Pools."

@shawmakesmagic shared a video demonstrating "Movement, emotes, voice, world context and item interaction" in what appears to be a virtual environment. In a separate conversation about mall decline, @shawmakesmagic retweeted @bubblebabyboi's suggestion that "If malls just rented the empty store fronts as office space for startups they would be booming." @shawmakesmagic also tweeted about privacy concerns, stating "Either privacy is dead or cataloguing eyeballs is bad." @dankvr retweeted @kepano's thoughts on communication, noting that "Concise explanations accelerate progress" because they "spread faster because they are easier" to understand and build upon.

Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. PR #4818 by lalalune moves the message server to a self-contained database and adds specifications to the core.

2. PR #4799 by 0xbbjoker fixes integration tests for the tee starter.

3. PR #4811 by wtfsayo makes the agent sidebar use the same height properties for consistency.

4. PR #4812 by yungalgo prevents the elizaos update from running in non-project directories, improving the update process.

5. PR #4809 also by yungalgo implements auto-update functionality for the eliza OS CLI.

Several pull requests were recently completed in the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. PR #4816 fixed typos in the codebase.

2. PR #4811 standardized the agent sidebar to use consistent height properties.

3. PR #4808 added functionality to manually write .env files to Fly.io.

4. PR #4807 fixed issues with TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) tests.

5. PR #4806 implemented merging of process.env variables into .env files.

Four issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. Issue #4805: A user named BinaryBluePeach reported being unable to find definition files for node or jest.

2. Issue #4814: User scottrepreneur reported that a new sample project fails end-to-end (e2e) tests.

3. Issue #4810: User visionpixel raised an issue about starting agents files without using the command-line interface (CLI).

4. Issue #4803: User omariosman reported being unable to use the plugin-evm feature.
From May 28-29, 2025, the GitHub repository elizaos/eliza saw 12 new pull requests with 5 of them merged, 4 new issues were created, and the project had 17 active contributors during this period.

The source provides information about the top contributors for the elizaOS/eliza repository. However, no specific details about the contributors or their contributions are provided in the source text.
